# Calculating a Rolling Window

```{r pec, include = FALSE}
# Load and attach packages
library(tidyverse)
library(zoo)
library(lubridate)

# Read DAX data
dax <-
  read_rds(
    "https://assets.datacamp.com/production/repositories/6083/datasets/f4059bd80d4b7e716f8a51ff6e3d974a0ead5b4c/EU_DAX.Rds"
  )
```



```{r}
# Calculate a rolling mean of seven days: dax_rollmean
dax_rollmean <- rollmean(dax,
                         k = 7,
                         align = "right")

# Plot dax_rollmean with autoplot
autoplot(dax_rollmean)
```

```{r}
# Calculate the 30-day rolling maximum
dax_rollmax <- rollmax(dax,
                       k = 30,
                       align = "right")

# Plot dax_rollmax with autoplot
autoplot(dax_rollmax)
```

```{r}
# Use rollapply to find the 30-day rolling minimum
dax_rollmin <- rollapply(
  dax,
  align = "right",
  width = 30,
  FUN = min
)

# Plot dax_rollmin with an autoplot
autoplot(dax_rollmin)
```
